bitenum.description: Transmit is disabled
Transmit is enabled

bitfield.description: TX teardown ready; read as zero, but always assumed to be one - unused

Receive is enabled

Host pending interrupt; raw interrupt read (before mask)
Statistics pending interrupt; raw interrupt read (before mask)

Statistics interrupt;mask; write one to enable interrupt

bitenum.description: Received CRC is discarded for all channels and is not included in the buffer descriptor packet length field
Received CRC is transferred to memory for all channels and is included in the buffer descriptor packet length
Receive QOS is disabled
Receive QOS is enabled
Received frames can span multiple buffers
RX DMA controller transfers each frame into a single buffer regardless of the frame or buffer size. All remaining frame data after the first buffer is discarded

bitfield.description: Receive copy MAC control frames enable

bitenum.description: MAC control frames are filtered (but acted upon if enabled)
MAC control frames are transferred to memory
Short frames are filtered
Short frames are transferred to memory
Frames containing errors are filtered
Frames containing errors are transferred to memory
Frames that do not address match are transferred to the promiscuous channel selected by RXPROMCH bits
Broadcast frames are filtered
Broadcast frames are copied to the channel selected by RXBROADCH bits
Multicast frames are filtered
Multicast frames are copied to the channel selected by RXMULTCH bits

register.description: Receive Filter Low Priority Frame Threshold Register

bitfield.description: RX free buffer count; Write to increment

bitfield.description: RX free buffer count; Write to increment

register.description: Receive Channel 7 Free Buffer Count Register

bitfield.description: RX free buffer count; Write to increment
Enables external select of Dupex/Gigabit modes
Receive Offset / Length word write block

bitenum.description: Do not block the DMA writes to the receive buffer descriptor offset/buffer length word

Block all EMAC DMA controller writes to the receive buffer descriptor offset/buffer length words during CPPI packet processing. When this bit is set, the EMAC will never write the third word to any receive buffer descriptor
The EMAC writes the RX ownership bit to zero at the end of packet processing
The EMAC writes the RX ownership bit to one at the end of packet processing
Idle not commanded
Idle commanded (read IDLE is MACSTATUS)
TX with a short IPG is disabled
TX with a short IPG (when TX_HSORT_GAP input is asserted) is enabled
The queue uses a round-robin scheme to select the next channel for transmission
The queue uses a fixed-priority (channel 7 highest priority) scheme to select the next channel for transmission

bitfield.description: FIFO RAM processor read/write enable (RAM test mode)

bitenum.description: TX pacing is disabled
TX pacing is enabled
GMII RX and TX are held in reset
GMII RX and TX are released from reset
TX flow control is disabled. Full-duplex mode: incoming pause frames are not acted upon
TX flow control is enabled. Full-duplex mode: incoming pause frames are acted upon
RX flow control is disabled. Half-duplex mode: no flow control generated collisions are sent. Full-duplex mode: no outgoing pause frames are sent
RX flow control is enabled. Half-duplex mode: collisions are initiated when receive flow control is triggered. Full-duplex mode: outgoing pause frames are sent when receive flow control is triggered
Loopback mode is disabled
Loopback mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Full duplex mode; gigabit mode forces full duplex mode regardless of whether the fullduplex bit isset or not

bitenum.description: Half-duplex mode
Full-duplex mode
The EMAC is not idle
The EMAC is in the idle state
No error
SOP error
Ownership bit not set in SOP buffer
Zero next buffer descriptor pointer without EOP
Zero buffer pointer
Zero buffer length
Packet length error (sum of buffers < packet length)
No error
Ownership bit not set in SOP buffer
Zero buffer pointer

bitfield.description: TX cell depth - the number of cells in the transmit FIFO
RX cell depth - the number of cells in the receive FIFO
MAC source address lower 8 bits MACADDR[7:0]
Least-significant 32 bits of the hash table corresponding to hash values 0 to 31
Most-significant 32 bits of the hash table corresponding to hash values 32 to 63

register.description: MAC Address Low - From Receive Address Matching Memory Map
MAC Address High - Receive Address Matching
